title: How to Win Apples to Apples Jr

steps.headline: Consider your judge.
steps.description: The person who is judging the cards will rotate with every turn, so pay attention to what each player tends to choose as the winning card. Do they tend to choose things that are silly and outlandish, funny and descriptive, or serious? Choose a card that you think the judge would most likely pick. This strategy works best if you know the judge's personality, likes and dislikes.

steps.headline: Attempt to persuade the judge.
steps.description:
Remember that the judge does not know whose card is whose, so you can use this to your advantage. After the judge reads the cards out loud, you can say things to encourage them to choose a particular card - either your own or a favorite. Try saying something like, “Wow! ___ ___ is a great combo. You should pick that one.”
Keep in mind that some judges will not be swayed by other players comments, but it doesn’t hurt to try!

steps.headline: Throw down your cards before your fellow players do.
steps.description: If you are playing by the rule that the last card thrown will not be judged, then playing your cards right away is a good idea. If you take too long to choose, then you may not get a chance to win a point for that hand. Try to decide which card you are going to play as fast as you can and then throw it down right away.

steps.headline: Play silly cards now and then.
steps.description: While the goal of the game is to play red cards with meanings that match the green card, make sure that you play a silly card now and then. Judges will often choose the silliest card as the winner even if some of the other cards do a better job of matching the meaning of the card. The rules of Apples to Apples Junior are very loose in this way because the game is more about having fun than being competitive.

steps.headline: Review the rules of Apples to Apples.
steps.description: Before you begin the game, it might help you to review the rules of the game. Apples to Apples is a simple game, but it can seem a bit odd when you first start playing because it is different from other games. If you are confused about the rules, then that might be preventing you from getting as many points as you can.

steps.headline: Make sure that you have seven cards at all times.
steps.description: You will receive seven cards when the game begins. At the start of each turn, you will get to draw a new card to replace the card you played on the last turn. This means that you should always have seven cards in your hand.

steps.headline: Play the word that best represents the adjective for that turn.
steps.description: During each turn, the judge will flip over an adjective card and your job is to play a card that matches that card’s meaning. You should choose the card that best matches the meaning of that card in your mind.

steps.headline: Hang onto the green cards that you win.
steps.description: The person with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner. That means that if you forget to take your green card or drop it, then you will have fewer points at the end of the game. Remember to hang onto the green cards that you win and keep them in your sights at all times.

steps.headline: Remember to have fun.
steps.description: While it is always nice to win a game, the real goal of any game night is to have fun! Try to focus on having fun and enjoying the company of friends and family when you play. Do your best to just relax and have a good time.
